name: df-ixp
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1
body: |- wceq(cixp(s0, c0, c1), cab(s1, wa(wfn(cv(s1), cab(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0))), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s0)), c1)))))
comment: Definition of infinite Cartesian product of [Enderton] p. 54. Enderton uses a bold "X" with ` x e. A ` written underneath or as a subscript, as does Stoll p. 47. Some books use a capital pi, but we will reserve that notation for products of numbers. Usually ` B ` represents a class expression containing ` x ` free and thus can be thought of as ` B ( x ) ` . Normally, ` x ` is not free in ` A ` , although this is not a requirement of the definition. (Contributed by NM, 28-Sep-2006.)
